a.g: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
[He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال السدي ﴿ الذي خلق الموت والحياة ليبلوكم أيكم احسن عملا ﴾ {} أي أيكم أكثرللموت ذكرا وأحسن له استعدادا وأشد منه خوفا وحذرا.
Indeed, He who created death [al-mawt] and life [al-hayah] to test you [liyabluwakum]—which of you is best in deed [ahsanu 'amalan]—meaning: which of you is most abundant in remembrance of death [dhikr al-mawt], and most excellent in preparation for it, and most intense in fear and caution of it.

a.g: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإلى الثاني بقوله تعالى: "الذي خلق سبع سموات طباقاً ما ترى في خلق الرحمن من تفاوت فارجع البصر هل ترى من فطور ثم ارجع البصر كرتين ينقلب إليك البصر خاسئاً وهو حسير" وهذا الطريق هو الأسهل على الأكثرين وهو الأوسع على السالكين، وإليه أكثر دعوة القرآن عند الأمر بالتدبر والتفكر والاعتبار والنظر في آيات خارجة عن الحصر.
Indeed, to the second [path] by His saying, the Most High: "Who created seven heavens in layers. You see no inconsistency in the creation of the Most Merciful [al-Rahman]. So return your vision [al-basar]; do you see any breaks? Then return your vision twice again. Your vision will return to you humbled [khasi'an] and weary [hasiran]." (67:3-4) And this path is the easiest for most, and it is the widest for the wayfarers [al-salikin]. And to it is most of the call of the Qur'an when commanding contemplation [al-tadabbur] and reflection [al-tafakkur] and taking heed [al-i'tibar] and looking [al-nazar] at signs beyond enumeration.

a.g: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وشرط له أجرة عليها وكان الشارط كريماً يفي بالوعد مهما وعد ولا يخلف بل يزيد، فجاء الأجير وكسر الأواني وأفسد جميعها ثم جلس ينتظر الأجر ويزعم أن المستأجر كريم، أفيراه العقلاء في انتظاره متمنياً مغروراً أو راجياً؟ وهذا للجهل بالفرق بين الرجاء والغرة. قيل للحسن: قوم يقولون نرجو الله ويضيعون العمل فقال: هيهات هيهات! تلك أمانيهم يترجحون فيها، من رجا شيئاً طلبه ومن خاف شيئاً هرب منه. وقال مسلم بن يسار: لقد سجدت البارحة حتى سقطت ثنيتاي! فقال له رجل: إنا لنرجو الله! فقال مسلم: هيهات هيهات؟ من رجا شيئاً طلبه ومن خاف شيئاً هرب منه. وكما أن الذي يرجوا في الدنيا ولداً وهو بعد لم ينكح أو نكح ولم يجامع أو جامع ولم ينزل! فهو معتوه فكذلك من رجا رحمة الله وهو لم يؤمن أو آمن لم يعمل صالحاً أو عمل ولم يترك المعاصي فهو مغرور. فكما أنه إذا نكح ووطئ وأنزل بقي متردداً في الولد يخاف ويرجو فضل الله في خلق الولد ودفع الآفات عن الرحم وعن الأم إلى أن يتم فهو كيس، فكذلك إذا آمن وعمل الصالحات وترك السيئات وبقي متردداً بين الخوف والرجاء يخاف أن لا يقبل منه وأن لا يدوم عليه وأن يختم له بالسوء، ويرجوا من الله تعالى أن يثبته بالقول الثابت ويحفظ دينه من صواعق سكرات الموت حتى يموت على التوحيد، ويحرس قلبه عن الميل إلى الشهوات بقية عمره حتى لا يميل إلى المعاصي فهو كيس، ومن عدا هؤلاء فهم المغرورون بالله "وسوف يعلمون حين يرون العذاب من أضل سبيل-ولتعلمن نبأه بعد حين" وعند ذلك يقولون كما أخبر الله عنهم "ربنا أبصرنا وسمعنا فارجعنا نعمل صالحاً إنا موقنون" أي علمنا أنه كما لا يولد إلا بوقاع ونكاح ولا ينبت زرع إلا بحراثة وبث بذر، فكذلك لا يحصل في الآخرة ثواب وأجر إلا بعمل صالح فارجعنا نعمل صالحاً فقد علمنا الآن صدقك في قولك "وأن ليس للإنسان إلا ما سعى وأن سعيه سوف يرى -كلما ألقى فيها فوج سألهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم نذير قالوا بلى قد جاءنا نذير" أي ألم نسمعكم سنة الله في عباده وأنه "توفى كل نفس ما كسبت" وأن "كل نفس بما كسبت رهينة" فما الذي غركم بالله بعد أن سمعتم وعقلتم؟ "قالوا لو كنا نسمع أو نعقل ما كنا في أصحاب السعير فاعترفوا بذنبهم فسحقاً لأصحاب السعير".
Indeed, a condition was set for him of a wage upon it, and the One Who set the condition is Generous [karim], fulfilling the promise whatever He promises, and does not break it, but rather increases. So the hired worker came and broke the vessels and ruined them all, then sat awaiting the wage, claiming that the employer is generous. Would the people of intellect see him in his waiting as one who is hopeful [raji] or as one who is deluded [maghrur]? This is from ignorance of the distinction between hope [raja'] and delusion [ghurra]. It was said to Al-Hasan: "A people say, 'We hope in God,' yet they neglect the work." He said: "Far be it, far be it! Those are their wishes [amaniyyah] they are swayed by. Whoever hopes for a thing seeks it, and whoever fears a thing flees from it." And Muslim ibn Yasar said: "Last night I prostrated until my front teeth fell out!" A man said to him: "Indeed, we hope in God!" Muslim said: "Far be it, far be it? Whoever hopes for a thing seeks it, and whoever fears a thing flees from it." And just as he who hopes in the world [dunya] for a child, yet he has not married, or married but has not had intercourse, or had intercourse but has not emitted, he is foolish. Likewise, he who hopes for the mercy of God, yet he has not believed, or believed but has not done righteous deeds, or done them but has not abandoned sins, he is deluded [maghrur]. And just as when he marries, has intercourse, and emits, he remains in a state of uncertainty regarding the child, fearing and hoping for the grace [fadl] of God in creating the child and warding off afflictions from the womb and from the mother until it is complete, he is wise [kayyis]. Likewise, when he believes and does righteous deeds and abandons evil deeds, and remains in a state of uncertainty between fear [khawf] and hope [raja'], fearing that it will not be accepted from him and that he will not remain steadfast upon it and that his end will be sealed with evil, and hoping in God, the Exalted, that He will establish him with the firm word [al-qawl al-thabit] and protect his religion from the thunderbolts of the agonies of death until he dies upon monotheism [tawhid], and guards his heart [qalb] from inclining towards the desires for the rest of his life so that he does not incline towards sins, he is wise [kayyis]. And whoever is other than these, they are the ones deluded [maghrur] by God. "And they will know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in way. And you will know the tidings of it after a time." And at that time they will say, as God has informed about them: "Our Lord, we have seen and we have heard, so return us, we will do righteous deeds. Indeed, we are certain [muqinun]." That is, we have learned that just as a child is not born except by intercourse and marriage, and a crop does not sprout except by tilling and sowing seed, likewise, reward and wage are not attained in the Hereafter [akhirah] except by righteous deeds. So return us, we will do righteous deeds, for we have now learned the truth of Your saying: "And that for man is only what he has striven for, and that his striving is going to be seen. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them, 'Did there not come to you a warner?' They will say, 'Yes, a warner had come to us.'" That is, did we not hear you regarding the way of God [sunnat Allah] with His servants, and that "Every soul will be paid in full what it has earned," and that "Every soul, for what it has earned, is held in pledge"? So what deluded you [gharra] concerning God after you had heard and understood? "They will say, 'If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze.' So they will acknowledge their sin. Then, away with the companions of the Blaze!"

a.g: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قالوا لو كنا نسمع أو نعقل ما كنا في أصحاب السعير فاعترفوا بذنبهم فسحقاً لأصحاب السعير. فإن قلت: فأين مظنة الرجاء وموضعه المحمود؟ فاعلم أنه محمود في موضعين: أحدهما: في حق العاصي المنهمك إذا خطرت له التوبة فقال له الشيطان: وأنى تقبل توبتك فيقنطه من رحمة الله تعالى فيجب عند هذا أن يقمع القنوط بالرجاء ويتذكر "إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعاً" وأن الله كريم يقبل التوبة عن عباده وأن التوبة طاعة تكفر الذنوب قال الله تعالى "قل يا عبادي الذين أسرفوا على أنفسهم لا تقنطوا من رحمة الله إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعاً إنه هو الغفور الرحيم وأنيبوا إلى ربكم" أمرهم بالإنابة وقال تعالى "وإني لغفار لمن تاب وآمن وعمل صالحاً ثم اهتدى" فإذا توقع المغفرة مع التوبة فهو راج، وإن توقع المغفرة مع الإصرار فهو مغرور، كما أن من ضاق عليه وقت الجمعة وهو في السوق فخطر له أن يسعى إلى الجمعة فقال له الشيطان: إنك لا تدرك الجمعة فأقم على موضعك فكذب الشيطان ومر يعدو وهو يرجو أن يدرك الجمعة فهو راج، وإن استمر على التجارة وأخذ يرجو تأخير الإمام للصلاة لأجله إلى وسط الوقت أو لأجل غيره أو لسبب من الأسباب التي لا يعرفها فهو مغرور. الثاني: أن تفتر نفسه عن فضائل الأعمال ويقتصر على الفرائض فيرجى نفسه نعيم الله تعالى وما وعد به الصالحين حتى ينبعث من الرجاء نشاط العبادة فيقبل على الفضائل ويتذكر قوله تعالى "قد أفلح المؤمنون الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون" إلى قوله "أولئك هم الوارثون الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون" فالرجاء الأول: يقمع القنوط المانع من التوبة. الرجاء الثاني: يقمع الفتور المانع من النشاط والتشمر، فكل توقع حث على توبة أو على تشمر في العبادة فهو رجاء، وكل رجاء أوجب فتوراً في العبادة وركوناً إلى البطالة فهو غرة، كما إذا خطر له أن يترك الذنب ويشتغل بالعمل فيقول له الشيطان: مالك ولإيذاء نفسك وتعذيبها ولك رب كريم غفور رحيم؟ فيفتر بذلك عن التوبة والعبادة فهو غرة، وعند هذا واجب على العبد أن يستعمل الخوف فيخوف نفسه بغضب.
Indeed they will say, "If only we had been listening [sami'na] or reasoning [na'qilu], we would not be among the companions of the Blaze [ashab al-sa'ir]." So they acknowledged their sin. Then, away with the companions of the Blaze! If you ask: "Then where is the place of hope [raja'] and its praiseworthy location?" Know that it is praiseworthy in two places: The first: For the disobedient one who is immersed [in sin], when the thought of repentance [tawba] occurs to him, and Satan says to him, "How could your repentance be accepted?" causing him to despair [yaqnutu] of the mercy of Allah, the Exalted. At this point, it is necessary to suppress that despair with hope [raja'] and to remember, "Indeed, Allah forgives all sins," and that Allah is Generous, accepting repentance from His servants, and that repentance is an act of obedience that expiates sins. Allah, the Exalted, says, "Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.' And turn to your Lord [rabbikum]." He commanded them to turn [inaba]. And He, the Exalted, says, "And indeed, I am Forgiving to whoever repents and believes and does righteous work and then continues in guidance." So, if he anticipates forgiveness [maghfira] along with repentance, he is one who hopes [raji]. But if he anticipates forgiveness while persisting [in sin], he is deluded [maghrur]. It is like one for whom the time for Friday prayer has become tight while he is in the market, and the thought occurs to him to hasten to the Friday prayer. Satan says to him, "You will not catch the prayer," so he should remain in his place. If he rejects Satan's lie and goes running, hoping to catch the Friday prayer, he is one who hopes. But if he continues with his trade and begins to hope that the Imam will delay the prayer for his sake until the middle of the time, or for the sake of another, or for some reason he does not know, he is deluded. The second: When his soul [nafs] becomes sluggish concerning the virtues of deeds [fada'il al-a'mal] and he confines himself to the obligatory duties [fara'id], he should inspire hope in his soul for the bliss [na'im] of Allah, the Exalted, and what He has promised the righteous, so that from that hope [raja'] a vigor for worship [nashat al-'ibada] may spring forth, and he turns to the virtues. And he should remember the saying of Allah, the Exalted, "Certainly will the believers have succeeded: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive" up to His saying, "Those are the inheritors who will inherit Paradise, wherein they will abide eternally." Thus, the first hope suppresses the despair that prevents repentance. The second hope suppresses the sluggishness [futur] that prevents vigor and exertion [tashammur]. So, every anticipation that urges towards repentance or towards exertion in worship is hope [raja']. And every hope that causes sluggishness in worship and complacency in idleness is delusion [ghurra], just as when the thought occurs to him to abandon sin and engage in worship, Satan says to him, "What is it to you, harming and tormenting yourself? You have a Lord who is Generous, Forgiving, Merciful." So he becomes sluggish because of that regarding repentance and worship—that is delusion. And at this point, it is incumbent upon the servant ['abd] to employ fear [khawf], frightening his soul with [divine] wrath.

a.g: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل الثاني: العلم بأنه تعالى عالم بجميع الموجودات ومحيط بكل المخلوقات لا يعزب عن علمه مثقال ذرة في الأرض ولا في السماء صادق في قوله وهو بكل شيء عليم ومرشد إلى صدقه بقوله تعالى ألا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير أرشدك إلى الاستدلال بالخلق على العلم بأنك لا تستريب في دلالة الخلق اللطيف والصنع المزين بالترتيب ولو في الشيء الحقير الضعيف على علم الصانع بكيفية الترتيب والترصيف فما ذكره الله سبحانه هو المنتهى في الهداية والتعريف.
Indeed, the second foundation: the knowledge [ma'rifa] that He, the Exalted, is the Knower [al-'Alim] of all existent things and encompasses every created being. Not an atom's weight [mithqal dharrah] in the earth or in the heavens escapes His knowledge ['ilm]. He is truthful in His saying, and He is, of all things, Knowing [Khabir]. And He guides to the truth of this with His saying, the Exalted: "Does He not know, He Who created? And He is the Subtle, the Aware [al-Latif al-Khabir]." He guides you to inferring from creation [khalq] the knowledge ['ilm]—so that you do not doubt in the indication of the subtle creation [al-khalq al-latif] and the workmanship [sana'] adorned with precise arrangement, even in the small, weak thing, pointing to the knowledge ['ilm] of the Maker [al-Sani'] of the manner of that arrangement and composition. Thus, what God, glorified is He, has mentioned is the ultimate in guidance [hudan] and making known [ta'rif].

a.g: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل الثاني: العلم بأنه تعالى عالم بجميع الموجودات ومحيط بكل المخلوقات لا يعزب عن علمه مثقال ذرة في الأرض ولا في السماء صادق في قوله وهو بكل شيء عليم ومرشد إلى صدقه بقوله تعالى ألا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير أرشدك إلى الاستدلال بالخلق على العلم بأنك لا تستريب في دلالة الخلق اللطيف والصنع المزين بالترتيب ولو في الشيء الحقير الضعيف على علم الصانع بكيفية الترتيب والترصيف فما ذكره الله سبحانه هو المنتهى في الهداية والتعريف.
Indeed, the second foundation: knowledge [ma'rifa] that He, the Exalted, is the Knower [al-'Alim] of all existent things and encompasses every created being. Not an atom's weight [mithqal dharrah] in the earth or in the heavens escapes His knowledge [ilm]. He is truthful in His saying, and He is, of all things, Knowing [Khabir]. And He guides to the truth of this with His saying, the Exalted: "Does He not know, He Who created? And He is the Subtle, the Aware [al-Latif al-Khabir]." He guides you to the proof [dalil] through creation [khalq] for the knowledge [ilm]—that you do not doubt in the indication [dalalah] of the subtle creation [al-khalq al-latif] and the adorned making [al-san' al-muzayyan] with perfect order, even in the small, weak thing, pointing to the knowledge [ilm] of the Maker [al-Sani'] of the manner of its ordering and arrangement. Thus, what God, glorified is He, has mentioned is the ultimate in guidance [hidayah] and definition [ta'rif].

a.g: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإذا عرفت طريق الفكر في نفسك فتفكر في الأرض التي هي مقرك ثم في أنهارها وجبالها ومعادنها ثم ارتفع منها إلى ملكوت السموات أما الأرض فمن آياته أن خلق الأرض فراشا ومهادا وسلك فيها سبلا فجاجا وجعلها ذلولا لتمشوا في مناكبها وجعلها قارة لا تتحرك وأرسى فيها الجبال أوتادا لها تمنعها من أن تميد ثم وسع أكنافها حتى عجز الآدميون عن بلوغ جميع جوانبها وإن طالت إعمارهم وكثر تطوافهم فقال تعالى هو الذي جعل لكم الأرض ذلولا فامشوا في مناكبها.
Indeed, when you have come to know the path of reflection [al-fikr] within your own self, then reflect upon the earth [al-ard] which is your dwelling place. Then reflect upon its rivers, its mountains, and its minerals. Then ascend from it to the dominion [malakūt] of the heavens. As for the earth, from among His signs [āyāt] is that He created the earth as a carpet and a bed, and He made in it wide roads, and He made it subservient [dhallūlan] so that you may walk upon its shoulders. And He made it stable, not moving, and He set firm within it mountains as pegs for it, preventing it from shaking. Then He expanded its regions until human beings fell short of reaching all its sides, even if their lifespans were long and their travels abundant. Thus, the Most High has said: "He is the One who made the earth subservient [dhallūlan] for you, so walk upon its shoulders."

a.g: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.
Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن يطلب الأصول من التوابع لا بد وأن يزل وإلى الفريقين الإشارة بقوله تعالى: ﴿ أفمن يمشي مكبا على وجهه أهدى أمن يمشي سويا على صراط مستقيم ﴾ {} فإن الكفار لم يغلطوا فيما غلطوا فيه إلا بمثل هذه الانعكاسات، نسأل الله حسن التوفيق بكرمه ولطفه.
Indeed, he who seeks the foundations [al-usul] from the derivatives [al-tawa'bi'] will inevitably slip. And to both groups is the allusion in His, the Exalted's, saying: "Is he who walks fallen on his face better guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path [sirat mustaqim]?" For the disbelievers only erred in what they erred in due to such inversions. We ask God for the goodness of success [tawfiq] through His generosity and subtle grace.

a.g: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful."
Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
Say, "The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."
Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"
Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
